question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

Then, is Francis Suarez selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This is based on the odds indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically for July 19, and will be resolved as soon as data for July 20 becomes available. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, the nearest previous figures will be used.

Then, is it true that Francis Suarez will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Suarez is selected as the nominee, and NO if any other candidate is selected. This decision is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Given 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out, as shown on the New York Times interactive election page. Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Resolution criteria:
- Condition: Resolves YES if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive election page shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, resolves NO.
- Outcome: Resolves YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Resolves NO if only one ballot is required.

question.title: Conditional on fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out before July 20, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024. This is determined by the New York Times tracking page, which resolves as 'Yes' if at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This question resolves as 'Yes' if more than one round of voting is needed, indicating a brokered convention. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as 'No'.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI committing to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement indicating a new level of commitment, and this commitment is verified by Metaculus to satisfy at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Then, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly? The Pandemic Agreement's approval is determined by a vote during the May 2024 WHA, as reported by credible sources.

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI not committing to "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" by July 1, 2024, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle. This means at least one of the following must be true:

- OpenAI has not issued a new public statement of commitment to this principle, either formally or informally, that indicates a new level of commitment compared to when the righttowarn.ai statement was published.
- Metaculus has not verified that OpenAI's commitment is satisfactory to at least one member of righttowarn.ai, with statements being at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step".

Given this condition, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly? This resolves as **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote during the May 2024 WHA, according to credible sources. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on the US government ending its agreement with Verisign for .com management by August 3, 2024, will Joe Biden announce by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD).

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if the US Department of Commerce ends the agreement with Verisign before August 3, 2024. Resolves No otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. Resolves No if such a statement is not made before the deadline.

question.title: Conditional on the US government continuing its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management on or after August 3, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two events:

1. **Condition**: The US government continues its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, on or after August 3, 2024. This resolves as Yes if on or after August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) has not officially terminated or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does happen before August 3, 2024, this question resolves as No.

2. **Outcome**: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made prior to the deadline, this resolves as No.

Suppose the following is true: The US government continues its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD management on or after August 3, 2024. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

question.title: Given France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will at least 24 world records be broken?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between France's performance and the breaking of world records at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Then, will at least 24 world records be broken during the Paris Olympics? This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

question.title: Conditional on France failing to place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will at least 24 world records be broken?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where France does not place in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, which resolves positively if France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve negatively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by the number of Gold Medals, Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals in case of ties.

Given this scenario, the question then asks: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This will resolve as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: If Donald Trump is removed from the primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports, excluding speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements. If Trump is removed or blocked and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked, this condition is not met.

Then, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This resolves as YES if the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control or claimed Russian territory. It resolves as NO if the location is not shown as under Russian control, including categories indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is not removed from any primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. There are no official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports confirming such a removal or block. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves affirmatively.

Then, is it true that on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location? The question will resolve as **Yes** if the location is in any of these categories indicating Russian control, and **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

Suppose the above condition is true: Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat. Then, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

The resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks them to vote with a generic Democrat. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Trump in the Biden poll does not exceed that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more.

Suppose the following is true: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains less than 3% among Manifold respondents. Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria:
- For the first condition: The answer is YES if the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)) for the Biden poll minus the same formula for the generic Democrat poll is less than 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.
- For the second condition: Resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on diplomatic expulsions or recalls taking place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, will such events occur again before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the likelihood of repeated diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China within a short timeframe.

Suppose the following is true: Before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Given these events have occurred, will another such event occur before August 1, 2024? The same criteria apply for resolution: any one of the above events happening again will resolve this question as Yes. If no such reports occur before that date, it resolves as No.

question.title: Given no diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, will there be any before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before June 1, 2024, the Philippines and China have no diplomatic expulsions or recalls. This means:

- The Philippines does not expel any diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC does not expel any diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC does not recall any of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Then, is it true that before August 1, 2024, at least one of these events will occur:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the PRC.
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines?

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as Yes if any of the above events happen between June 1, 2024, and August 1, 2024. If none of these events occur before August 1, 2024, it resolves as No.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Given there is another Democratic party presidential debate, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. Resolves NO if such a statement is not made before the deadline.

question.title: Conditional on there being no more Democratic party presidential debates, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There are no debates between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for condition: Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO if there is at least one such debate.

Resolution criteria for outcome: Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. Resolves NO if such a statement is not made prior to the deadline.

This conditional question combines the criteria of both base questions, ensuring all relevant details are retained.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is reported as greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. This is accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this measure, a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Given this condition, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, and No otherwise.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is <= 3 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4. This is determined by the value reported on the chart for that date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead and a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Then, is it true that Ted Cruz will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will resolve as Yes if Ted Cruz is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the election day.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Given ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind publish a report on external red-teaming by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it, even if unavailable in certain countries or to specific groups like minors. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the service is substantially the same even if the name or website has changed.

Then, is it true that Google DeepMind will publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI's ChatGPT not being generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Google DeepMind publish a report with external red-teaming results by then?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Not generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

Then, is it true that Google DeepMind will publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024? For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: If Joe Biden has an in-person interview on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but includes appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Resolution criteria for this condition: The market resolves YES if such an interview occurs before the end of July 2024, and NO if no qualifying interview is released by then.

Given this condition, the question is whether Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for that date. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. The value will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: If Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose Joe Biden does not have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this condition is not met. The condition excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls. It includes appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, but there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Given this condition, will Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This question will resolve based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

Suppose this happens. Then, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, remain in her position and not resign, not be fired, and for no other reason continue to be the director of the Secret Service until October 12, 2024? 

Suppose this is true. Then, will there be an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th? 

The question resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before the specified time. Otherwise, it resolves NO. If the condition regarding the Secret Service head is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring or killing at least one person other than the terrorist(s) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The event is described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi? If the ICC issues such a warrant before July 1, 2024, the question resolves as Yes. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on no terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: No terrorist attack in metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will the International Criminal Court (ICC) issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members before July 1, 2024?

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Slovenia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta also qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for Malta: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Slovenia failing to qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? If Malta qualifies, the question resolves as **Yes**. If Malta does not qualify, the question resolves as **No**. If Slovenia does not fail to qualify, the condition is not met.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Greens–EFA also hold the most seats?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group also holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If both GUE/NGL and Greens–EFA are tied for the most seats, this question resolves as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Given GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats, will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This means that GUE/NGL either has fewer seats than the group with the most seats or is not tied for the most seats. Now, under this condition, will the Greens–EFA political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria:
1. For the condition (GUE/NGL not holding the most seats): This resolves as **Yes** if GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats. If GUE/NGL holds the most seats or is tied for the most, it resolves as **No**.
2. For the outcome (Greens–EFA holding the most seats): This resolves as **Yes** if Greens–EFA holds the most seats and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for the most seats, both are considered to hold the most seats.

Both criteria are based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Given 538 Projects Biden as the favorite on Friday, will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: FiveThirtyEight projects Joe Biden as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump on July 19, 2024. This is determined by the FiveThirtyEight election forecast numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for that date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this is considered a 50-50 resolution. The resolution is based on the July 19 data as soon as July 20 data becomes available, or the nearest previous data if July 19 data is unavailable by July 22, 11:59 PM ET.

Given this scenario, will Tim Scott be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who receives the nomination on election day.

question.title: If 538 projects Trump as the favorite on July 19, will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast. Then, is it true that Tim Scott will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for P: This resolves to “Yes” if Trump is projected as the favorite on July 19, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast. If Biden is projected as the favorite, it resolves to “No”. If the odds are equal, it resolves 50-50.

Resolution criteria for Q: This resolves to “Yes” if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Otherwise, it resolves to “No.”

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

question.title: Given that the same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question examines the conditional probability of an athlete winning multiple medals in tennis, given that a single nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

The condition (P) is that at the 2024 Paris Olympics, the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in at least two of the following women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. If women's teams from eight different NOCs win gold in these sports, the condition is not met.

The outcome (Q) is that an athlete wins at least two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Resolution: If the condition is met, resolve **Yes** if the outcome is true; resolve **No** if the outcome is false. If the condition is not met, resolve as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on no nation winning more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis?
question.body:
This question examines the outcomes of the 2024 Paris Olympics with two specific conditions:

Condition: No nation wins more than one women's team sport. This resolves as **Yes** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**.

Outcome: An athlete winning more than one medal for tennis. This resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

If the condition is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement is unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, is it true that before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: If Joe Biden does not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will he be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. This means there is no unambiguous and conclusive statement leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Resolution criteria: This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:

This occurs if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to this effect, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Given Joe Biden does not announce he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination, will Kamala's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. Given this, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves YES if Joe Biden or his campaign does not make such an announcement by the specified time. Resolves NO if such an announcement is made.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The polling average must show Trump leading Biden by more than 3 but not more than 4 points on July 15, 2024. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Given FiveThirtyEight projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is projected as the favorite to win the US presidential election over Donald Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast for July 19, 2024. This means that Biden has a higher probability of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's blue and red trend lines for that date. If no data is available for July 19, the nearest previous figures will be used.

Then, is it true that before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," thus causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President? This does not include Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment. The duration of incapacity does not matter for this question.

question.title: If 538 projects Biden as not the favorite on July 19, will he be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast. This is determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast for that date, with the resolution based on the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used.

Then, is it true that before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President? The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., or invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment, does not count.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

Resolution criteria for P: The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for the poll with Joe Biden - the formula for the poll with a generic Democrat >= 0.03.

Then, is it true that a member of the Trump family will be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if one of the following individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if no public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

Suppose the following is true: Fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. Then, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
