The question resolves as **Yes** if both conditions are met. If Iceland does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A. If Iceland qualifies but Albania does not, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: If Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The outcome resolves as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: Given Democrats avoid a brokered convention in 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Then, is Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Resolves as **No** if more than one ballot is required.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average. 

Resolution criteria for this condition: This is based on the value reported by 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is the following true? On July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected as the favorite to win the US presidential election according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. If Trump is favored, it resolves to “No.” If the odds are equal, it resolves 50-50. The resolution is based on the odds reported by FiveThirtyEight, ignoring any changes in methodology.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being <= 2 or > 4 on July 15, 2024, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is either less than or equal to 2 points or greater than 4 points, as reported on the chart for that date. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, on July 19, 2024, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast? This will resolve to “Yes” if Biden has a higher probability, “No” if Trump has a higher probability, or 50-50 if they have equal odds. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on the Pandemic Agreement being approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Conditional on Iran initiating a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this scenario, a "military action" is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will count. Attacks by proxy forces will not count.

Then, given this situation, will credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels?

question.title: Conditional on no Iranian military response before August 13th, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
This question considers two separate conditions:

1. **Condition**: No Iranian military response before August 13th, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. This is determined by whether Iran initiates any military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Military action includes any use of force such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions that are officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or confirmed by credible sources. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Actions by proxy forces like Hezbollah or Houthis do not count unless explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to originate from Iranian territory.

2. **Outcome**: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial? This resolves as YES if credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, either in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Suppose the first condition is met: No Iranian military response occurs as defined. Then, is the second condition true: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?

question.title: Conditional on fewer than 10 Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out before July 20, will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Resolution criteria for the condition: If at no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, the condition is met. Otherwise, it is not.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves to N/A.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

question.title: Given Albania qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia also qualify?
question.body: This question examines the scenario where Albania qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Specifically, it resolves as **Yes** if both Albania and Georgia participate in their respective Semi-finals and are both officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Albania qualifies but Georgia does not, it resolves as **No**. If Albania does not qualify, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given Albania fails to qualify, will Georgia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Albania does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then is it true that Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given San Marino qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Czechia also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given San Marino fails to qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Czechia qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: San Marino must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as not having qualified for the Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Czechia must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for a 'Yes' resolution. If Czechia does not qualify, the resolution is 'No'. If the condition is not met, the resolution is 'N/A'.

question.title: Will Moldova qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Moldova participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Australia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Australia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Australia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Moldova qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Australia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024. This means that Australia participated in a Semi-final and was officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Moldova qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? This means that Moldova must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

question.title: Given Australia fails to qualify for the Grand Final, will Moldova qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as not having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Moldova qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria for Moldova: Resolves Yes if Moldova participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Resolves No otherwise.

question.title: Will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Then, will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024? This question resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
question.body:
This market will resolve YES, if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment, will Elon Musk attend the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

Then, will Elon Musk become a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024? The market will resolve YES if Elon Musk appears as a guest on the official stage during the event.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump not being removed from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

Then, will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024? This market will resolve YES if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Conditional on the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. Then, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, will the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources?

question.title: Conditional on the EU not announcing new tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Fidesz-KDNP maintain its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The European Union does not announce any new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024. This means there are no credible reports of such announcements. Then, is it true that Fidesz-KDNP will maintain its plurality in the European Parliament from Hungary in 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Resolves Yes if, before July 5, 2024, there are no credible reports of the EU announcing new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles.
- For the outcome: Resolves Yes if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thus maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament according to credible sources.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Mike Pence is the Republican nominee, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time? If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before this time, the resolution is yes. Otherwise, the resolution is no.

question.title: Conditional on Mike Pence not being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any candidate other than Mike Pence is selected, this condition is met. 

The question then asks whether, given this scenario, President Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden drops out before July 20, otherwise resolves NO.
If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this, will Will Hurd be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as their nominee.

question.title: Given Joe Biden does not announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden does not make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. This leaves open the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Resolution criteria for this condition: Resolves Yes if no such announcement is made by the deadline, and No if such an announcement is made.

Now, given this condition, will Will Hurd be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as Yes if Will Hurd is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and No otherwise. The resolution is solely determined by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Given Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: On June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, as checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC) on [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/). Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024? For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: If Nvidia's market cap is less than or equal to Apple's on June 28, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is less than or equal to Apple's, as determined by Companies Market Cap and checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). Given this condition, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024? A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdon at D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Given Deadpool & Wolverine has the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie, will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds. It is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend, potentially marking the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. The record to beat is the original Deadpool at $284.5M globally.

Resolution criteria for P: This resolves YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports, AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

Resolution criteria for Q: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It resolves NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense, or if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park.

question.title: Conditional on Deadpool & Wolverine NOT having the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie, will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses $284.5M or less globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> OR the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) does NOT report it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is <=$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

Suppose the following is true: Deadpool & Wolverine does NOT have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Then, will Disney announce a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024?

This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Given ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, even if the name or website has changed, as long as the service is substantially the same.

Then, is it true that the Greens–EFA political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This resolves as YES if the Greens–EFA holds the most seats, and NO otherwise. Ties for the most seats also count as YES. This is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Given ChatGPT is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 30, 2024, OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union. This means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN, or less than or equal to 50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and it resolves positively if the service is substantially the same even if the name or website has changed.

Then, is it true that the Greens–EFA political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA group holds the most seats, and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, it resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

Then, consider the following question: Will "Twisters" (2024) achieve a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% one week after its release on July 26th? For the resolution, the Tomatometer score will be used as displayed on Rotten Tomatoes, typically an integer percentage, to determine if it meets or exceeds the 75% threshold. The term "Certified Fresh" is used illustratively, focusing solely on the displayed score.

question.title: Given the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is lower than or equal to that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two independent movie performance indicators: box office openings and critical scores.

Condition: The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" must be lower than or equal to $185,548,391, which is the combined opening of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), as reported by Boxofficemojo.

Outcome: If the condition is met, the question resolves YES if "Twisters" (2024) achieves a Rotten Tomatoes Tomatometer score of at least 75% one week after its release (July 26th), based on the score displayed on its Rotten Tomatoes page, using the precision listed there (typically an integer percentage). "Certified Fresh" is used here for illustrative purposes, focusing solely on the score displayed.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

Given this situation, we want to know if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024. The polling average will be accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. For example, a value of 2.4 means Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

For the interview to qualify, it must not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. For context, interviews like Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes, qualify. If no such interview is released by the end of July, the question resolves NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given the Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two political events within the Democratic Party in the context of the 2024 US presidential election. 

Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, indicating a brokered convention.

Then, is the following also true? At least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden earlier than originally planned, before the market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Resolution criteria: The first condition resolves as YES if a brokered convention occurs as described. The second condition resolves as YES if at least 20 signatures are collected on such a public letter before the specified deadline. If either condition is not met, the respective component resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on Democrats not having a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, thus not having a brokered convention. Then, is it true that at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party will sign a public letter opposing the plan to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if only one round of voting is required in the Democratic Party's roll call ballot. Resolves NO if more than one ballot is required.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

If Liz Cheney is not selected as the nominee by the Republican National Convention, this resolves as No.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being <= 2 or > 3 on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question considers the condition where Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is either less than or equal to 2 points or greater than 3 points, as reported on July 15, 2024. This information will be accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this condition, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Given this condition, the question resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. The determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Conditional on Kamala's odds of winning increasing, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model. Specifically, this means the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. 

Given this condition, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This will resolve as YES if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other outcomes will resolve as NO. This determination is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

If the condition regarding Kamala's odds is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given Kamala's odds of winning do not increase over the next week, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. This condition resolves as YES if the probability is <=46.6%, and NO otherwise.

Then, is it true that Ted Cruz will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as YES if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and NO otherwise. The resolution is based on the decision of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will Sifan Hassan win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: Resolves YES if Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, NO otherwise

question.title: Conditional on Sifan Hassan winning a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Sifan Hassan wins any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then is it true that both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to credible sources?

question.title: Conditional on Sifan Hassan failing to win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Sifan Hassan does not win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris be won by athletes with Kalenjin roots? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Sifan Hassan does not win any medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, NO otherwise.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if both the winner of the men's and the winner of the women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to credible sources.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump Jr. being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will ISS advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
question.body:
Suppose Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Given this, will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting?

Criterion for condition: Resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected as the Republican nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if ISS releases a statement explicitly advising against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given Donald Trump Jr. is not the Republican nominee for 2024, will ISS advise against Elon Musk's package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This condition resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If he is selected, it resolves as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will Kamala Harris become President by July 26, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al]* before June 1, 2024. Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? 

Resolution criteria for P: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in the specified case before June 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for Q: This resolves to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is not charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will Kamala Harris become President by July 26, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is not charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024. Then, will Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Donald Trump is not charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

question.title: Will the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals?

It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: The question resolves as Yes if the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as No for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Conditional on the Los Angeles Clippers winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will the Boston Celtics also win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as Yes if both the Los Angeles Clippers and the Boston Celtics are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as No if only the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned champions, as the Boston Celtics cannot also win in that case. 

If the Los Angeles Clippers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals, the condition is not met, and the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given the Los Angeles Clippers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals, will the Boston Celtics win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Los Angeles Clippers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Then, will the Boston Celtics be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals?

Resolution criteria:
- The condition is met if the Los Angeles Clippers do not win the 2024 NBA Finals.
- The outcome resolves as Yes if the Boston Celtics are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. It resolves as No if any other team is crowned the champion.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Given Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This means the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoked Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and caused the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this condition.

We are interested in whether Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves as Yes if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, will Nikki Haley be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as Yes if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. The resolution is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
